Incisional surgical site infection ( SSI ) , microbiological culture infect surgical wound , postoperative pain acute phase reactant investigate .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Vitamin E Ointment Incisional SSI Colorectal Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: A prospective , randomize study perform . The patient randomize 2 group : patient undergo subcutaneous sterile vitamin E acetate ointment application ( Group 1 ) patient receive vitamin E ointment application ( Group 2 ) . Before skin staple subcutaneous irrigation normal saline , sterile Vitamin E acetate ointment ( FilmeOft , Hulka SRL , Rovigo , Italy ) apply subcutaneous tissue ; 2 ml apply suprapubic incision 0.5 ml rest port site . Incisional SSI , microbiological culture infect surgical wound , postoperative pain evaluate 24 hour surgery mean Visual Analogic Scale ( VAS ) , range 0 mm ( complete absence pain ) 100 mm ( unbearable pain ) acute phase reactant ( white cell count ( WBC ) , fibrinogen C reactive protein ) 48 hour surgery investigate .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis colorectal neoplasm plan undergo elective laparoscopic surgery curative aim Open surgical approach conversion laparotomy Performance stoma Immunodepression status Anastomotic leak
